urls.title: Please DO NOT remove Luma Curve or RGB Curves in future updates
urls.description: Luma Curve and RGB Curves are currently in the obsolete folder in the effects panel. These are important and simple tools the deserve to have their own separate effect, outside of Lumetri. I often use multiple Luma Curve effects underneath my Lumetri effect, so that I can adjust the tone of a shot before adding any LUTs and addition color correction. Currently, Lumetri's curves set is after all basic and secondary color effects, which means there's no way to setup the tones of a shot. Please do not remove these effects from Premeire. It would cause Premiere's color grading process to become even more difficult.

7) The best way to influence the culture and speak truth to power is through social media and not through books or scholarship or face to face relationships or building institutions. 

I believe these seven habits make social media extremely problematic.

5) I can attribute opinions to you that I suspect you would not own. 6) There are only three categories for tweets: a) those on my side b) those on the other evil side, c) wrongfully trying to compromise in the middle. There are no other kinds.

3) If you cite person X at all you must answer for everything person X ever did or said. 4) I only engage tweets that support my narrative of you. Other tweets, videos, articles, or books by you I can ignore as if you never said any of them.

OK, so I've used this platform long enough to make some observations. Here are seven Habits of Twitter best REJECTED: 1) The worst possible way to read a tweet is the right way. 2) If I can impute bad motives to you I don’t have to deal with your argument.
Great advice. https://t.co/fd9BL3eqtj

When Moses in midlife ventured beyond the comfortable confines of the royal palace he discovered a disturbing reality:

The privilege he enjoyed was built upon the backs of an exploited people—an exploited people he would learn to identify as his brothers and sisters.

It is America’s best idea.

I read all of Hemingway’s fiction & nonfiction in the late 90s. Great writer. But eventually I needed more light. Soon thereafter I found Dostoevsky. Dear Fyodor wasn’t afraid to write about the darkness(!), but he also knew how to affirm life and point his readers to the Light.
Theory on why Mr. Rogers has re-emerged as an icon and Ted Lasso is such a favorite: People are exhausted by outrage, and are starved for kindness.

“Hope” 🚪
